intro: Cupania moralesii, commonly known as the Morales' cupania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in the understory of dense forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
